ProjectTitle: Thinking about Religious Education as 'Pag-alalay': A postcolonial, empirical and theological study into the theory and practice of Catholic religious education in the Philippines
InitialFeedbackHistory:
08/06/2023
Documentation: other documentation that would be important for your collection of interviews is a topics/question list (if used), a list of all interviews with key characteristics for each, for example date, place and time of the interview,  biographical characteristics of interviewees (age; gender, occupation; stakeholder group), etc. 
Guidance here: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/rdm-data-types/interview-data

Data storage: for interviews conducted in the Phillipines, you need a secure way to transfer the recordings (which are defined as personal data under GDPR) to the KU Leuven managed storage. And storing such personal data on OneDrive require extra safeguards, see: https://icts.kuleuven.be/sc/english/storage/extra_measures/. Check the iCTS storagewijzer to find the best secure solution to handle those personal data: https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en and describe this in more detail in your DMP.
Also indicate what happens with recordings after you transcribe them. Keep them? Delete them? Since these are personal data, if you keep them for 10 years that needs to be in a secure storage solution. 

Data preservation: you indicate that data will be archived via your OneDrive account for at least 10 years. That is not a good solution. OneDrive accounts are personal, so when you leave the university they are deleted. Data need to be preserved on a server or other storage device managed by the research group.

Data sharing: the Lirias repository is not for sharing research data, only for publications. KU Leuven RDR is for research data.

label: good with suggestions
